podAntiAffinity.description: podAntiAffinity with two possible values: soft and hard

annotations.description: The key-prefix is optional and cannot exceed 253 characters with following character set: [a-z0-9A-Z\.] The key cannot exceed 63 characters with following character set: [a-z0-9A-Z\_\.\-]

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the AppArmor profile for the fc-admin-server container. Should only be set if appArmorProfile.fc-admin-server.type is set to localhost.

type.description: The AppArmor type for the fc-admin-server container. Available options are "unconfined", "runtime/default", "localhost" and "" [default=""].

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the AppArmor profile for the fc-eval-api-server container. Should only be set if appArmorProfile.fc-eval-api-server.type is set to localhost.

type.description: The AppArmor type for the fc-eval-api-server container. Available options are "unconfined", "runtime/default", "localhost" and "" [default=""].

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the AppArmor profile for the status-cm-cleanup container. Should only be set if appArmorProfile.status-cm-cleanup.type is set to localhost.

type.description: The AppArmor type for the status-cm-cleanup container. Available options are "unconfined", "runtime/default", "localhost" and "" [default=""].

cpu.description: The average percentage of requested CPU utilization used by the Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) for scaling decisions. Default is 80% of fc-eval-api-server container's default CPU limit, but in case the container's CPU request- or limit is changed this value must also be changed accordingly.

memory.description: The average percentage of requested memory utilization used by the Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) for scaling decisions. Default is ~80% of fc-eval-api-server container's default Memory limit, but in case the container's memory request- or limit is changed this value must also be changed accordingly.

enabled.description: Enable/disable auto-scaling for fcEvaluationService workload. Note! Enabling auto-scaling in existing deployments which currently has a statically configured replica count will lead to Kubernetes first scaling down the replica count to 1 before the Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) adjusts the count using its defined replicas and scaling decisions.

maxReplicas.description: The maximum replicas the Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) may scale up to.

minReplicas.description: The minimum replicas the Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) may scale down to.

tlsport.description: The tls port for license manager

kafkaHost.description: FQDN of the local kafka proxy including port

logConnectionTtlMinutes.description: Log connection TTL (minutes) towards log transformer service. Connection will reset after configured number of minutes. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

streamingMethod.description: The local parameter for specifying the streaming method of service logs. It can be 'indirect', 'direct', 'dual', or null. If set to null, global.log.streamingMethod will be used to determine the streaming method

logQueueSize.description: Size of the log queue for streaming. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

logTimeoutSeconds.description: Timeout waiting for logs to be streamed (in seconds) before terminating. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

logTransformerHost.description: FQDN including port number of the log transformer service, don't include protocol. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

logTransformerNoTlsHost.description: FQDN including port number of the log transformer non tls service, don't include protocol. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

enabled.description: This allows the service to increment counters.

host.description: Host name of the pm server. this is used for pm metrics access if network policies are in use

serviceName.description: The subsystem name for all the metrics generated by the service to be prefixed

licenseEvaluationInterval.description: License evaluation interval (in minutes).License keys are evaluated at this interval

queueEvictionInterval.description: Queue Eviction interval (in minutes).Failed FC resources will not be requeued after this interval

stateSyncRetryInterval.description: Retry interval (in seconds) to sync resources state in secondary sites.

kafkaHost.description: FQDN of the local kafka proxy including port

logConnectionTtlMinutes.description: Log connection TTL (minutes) towards log transformer service. Connection will reset after configured number of minutes. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

streamingMethod.description: The local parameter for specifying the streaming method of service logs. It can be 'indirect', 'direct', 'dual', or null. If set to null, global.log.streamingMethod will be used to determine the streaming method

logQueueSize.description: Size of the log queue for streaming. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

logTimeoutSeconds.description: Timeout waiting for logs to be streamed (in seconds) be terminating. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

logTransformerHost.description: FQDN including port number of the log transformer service, don't include protocol. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

logTransformerNoTlsHost.description: FQDN including port number of the log transformer non tls service, don't include protocol. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

enabled.description: This allows the service to increment counters.

host.description: Host name of the pm server. this is used for pm metrics access if network policies are in use

serviceName.description: The subsystem name for all the metrics generated by the service to be prefixed

annotations.description: Global annotations. Global, service level, and resource-specific annotations are merged, no conflicts are allowed.

manual.description: Sets a fsGroup ID for all services. If manual set to empty namespace default configuration is used.

namespace.description: Sets a fsGroup to use namespace default. The following values are possible: true, false and "". If global.fsGroup.namespace set to "" or false, namespace default configuration is used.

internalIPFamily.description: InternalIPFamily configures the IP address family used for cluster-internal IP address. Available values are: IPv4, IPv6, and empty.

labels.description: Global labels. Global, service level, and resource-specific labels are merged, no conflicts are allowed.

streamingMethod.description: The global parameter for specifying the streaming method of service logs. It can be 'indirect', 'direct', 'dual', or null. If both global.log.streamingMethod and log.streamingMethod are set to null, it will choose 'indirect' by default

tolerations.description: Tolerations for pod assignment, this supports the fullAPI

supplementalGroups.description: SupplementalGroups is used for setting the GID value(s) for volume data that is used by the services. The value will be merged if both global and local value are set. supplementalGroup will not be set in helmchart if both global and local value are not set.

pullSecret.description: PullSecret used when fetching the image

repoPath.description: Repo where the image is located

url.description: Registry url to fetch image from

enabled.description: Configuration option to enable/disable TLS support

rolekind.description: Configuration of the security policy role kind. The following values are possible: ClusterRole, Role and "". Rolebinding will not be created with value "".

url.description: Registry url to fetch image from

repoPath.description: Repo where the image is located

url.description: Registry url to fetch image from

repoPath.description: Repo where the image is located

url.description: Registry url to fetch image from

repoPath.description: Repo where the image is located

pullSecret.description: PullSecret used when fetching the image

labels.description: List of key/value pairs of labels appended to every helm resource created by Function Controller helm chart

fcAdminService.description: This parameter is a placeholder for adding a list of egress traffic network policy labels of admin service. If this service wants to send traffic then it should add all its outgoing traffic network policy access labels using this parameter.

fcEvaluationService.description: This parameter is a placeholder for adding a list of egress traffic network policy labels of evaluation service. If this service wants to send traffic then it should add all its outgoing traffic network policy access labels using this parameter.

enabled.description: Network policy. The network policy will be enabled if both networkPolicy.enabled and global.networkPolicy.enabled are set to true.

priorityClassName.description: The pod priority for the service

supplementalGroups.description: SupplementalGroups is used for setting the GID value(s) for volume data that is used by the services. The value will be merged if both global and local value are set. supplementalGroup will not be set in helmchart if both global and local value are not set.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before probe is initiated

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before probe is initiated

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the seccomp profile for the fc-admin-server container. Should only be set if seccompProfile.fc-admin-server.type is set to Localhost

type.description: Feature of the Linux kernel for secure computing mode for fc-admin-server container. Available options are `Unconfined`, `RuntimeDefault`, `Localhost` and "" [default=""]

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the seccomp profile for the fc-eval-api-server container. Should only be set if seccompProfile.fc-eval-api-server.type is set to Localhost

type.description: Feature of the Linux kernel for secure computing mode for fc-eval-api-server container. Available options are `Unconfined`, `RuntimeDefault`, `Localhost` and "" [default=""]

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the seccomp profile for the status-cm-cleanup container. Should only be set if seccompProfile.status-cm-cleanup.type is set to Localhost

type.description: Feature of the Linux kernel for secure computing mode for status-cm-cleanup container. Available options are `Unconfined`, `RuntimeDefault`, `Localhost` and "" [default=""]

rolename.description: Rolename sets the name of the security policy role that is bound to the service account.

name.description: Name of the service account to be used

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Number of seconds after SIGTERM caught before shutting down

fcAdminService.description: The topology spread constant for fcAdminService

fcEvaluationService.description: The topology spread constant for fcEvaluationService

maxSurge.description: The maximum number of pods that can be created over the desired number of pods

maxUnavailable.description: The maximum number of pods that can be unavailable during the update process

maxSurge.description: The maximum number of pods that can be created over the desired number of pods

maxUnavailable.description: The maximum number of pods that can be unavailable during the update process
The maximum allowed number of unavailable pods of fc evaluation service during a planned disruption. This parameter is mutually exclusive with podDisruptionBudget.fcEvaluationService.minAvailable.

minAvailable.description: Minimum number of pods of fc evaluation service that must remain available during a planned disruption. This parameter is mutually exclusive with podDisruptionBudget.fcEvaluationService.maxUnavailable.

maxUnavailable.description: The maximum allowed number of unavailable pods of fc evaluation service during a planned disruption. This parameter is mutually exclusive with podDisruptionBudget.fcAdminService.minAvailable.

minAvailable.description: Minimum number of pods of fc evaluation service that must remain available during a planned disruption. This parameter is mutually exclusive with podDisruptionBudget.fcAdminService.maxUnavailable.
